DOC.brief_summary: Epidemiologic data consistently indicate colorectal cancer survivor improve quality-of-life prognosis engage physical activity . This study aim build epidemiologic work translate finding inform change patient behavior . The specific aim : ( 1 ) Develop mobile technology physical activity intervention among colorectal cancer patient complete therapy . ( 2 ) Conduct 3-month pilot randomize control trial utilize mobile technology increase physical activity among 40 men woman complete standard cytotoxic chemotherapy primary stage I-III colorectal cancer UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center . Participants intervention arm receive Fitbit® self-monitoring , interactive text message , educational print material ; participant control arm receive educational print material baseline give Fitbit® completion 3-mo . follow-up assessment .
DOC.brief_title: Self-monitoring Reminder Texts Increase Physical Activity After Cancer : Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial
DOC.criteria: stage IIII colon rectal adenocarcinoma complete standard cytotoxic chemotherapy medically indicate consider diseasefree baseline able speak read English contraindication moderate vigorous aerobic exercise able walk unassisted inactive baseline ( < 150 min/week moderate physical activity ) access mobile phone able navigate website , fill form web , communicate email , regular access internet
